article.title: A Game of Life on Penrose tilings

reason: 429 Quota exceeded for aiplatform.googleapis.com/generate_content_requests_per_minute_per_project_per_base_model with base model: gemini-1.5-pro. Please submit a quota increase request. https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/generative-ai/quotas-genai.
response:
## Figure 1 Quiz:

**What do the purple tiles in this figure represent?**

A. The intersections of all lines in the pentagrid.
B. Tiles of a specific type determined by the chosen vectors.
C. The starting configuration for a Game of Life simulation.
D. Tiles with more than four sides, indicating a singular tiling.

**Correct answer: B. Tiles of a specific type determined by the chosen vectors.** 

## Figure 2 Quiz:

**What Game Variant is being depicted in this figure?**

A. Variant (i): Game of Life played only on (i, j)-type tiles, others are "dead".
B. Variant (ii): Game of Life played on (i, j)-type tiles, other types associated and reflect the state of their associated dominant tile.
C. Variant (iii): Simultaneous, non-interacting copies of the Game of Life on each tile type.
D. Variant (iv): Interacting copies of the Game of Life on each tile type in a singular tiling.

**Correct answer: B. Variant (ii): Game of Life played on (i, j)-type tiles, other types associated and reflect the state of their associated dominant tile.**

## Figure 3 Quiz:

**What does the map φ applied to the points K(z₀) - K(z₃) represent in this figure?**

A. The positions of four different types of tiles in the pentagrid.
B. The coordinates of the vertices of a single tile in the associated tiling.
C. Four consecutive states of a "glider" moving through the pentagrid.
D. The four possible orientations of a single type of tile in the Penrose tiling.

**Correct answer: B. The coordinates of the vertices of a single tile in the associated tiling.**
